intro: Tetrapterys cuspidata, commonly known as the cuspidate tetrapterys, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly in countries like Brazil and Mexico. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with five lobes and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
